plan.question: Is it bug or a feature?
What is the name of the {taskType}?

bug.question: How is the user currently affected?

feature.question: How will the user be positively affected?

plan.question: What is the DOD (Definition of Done) of '{taskName}'?

yes.question: How much learning work is required for task '{taskName}'?
How much time needed to spend on knowledge sharing?
How much analytics work is required for task '{taskName}'?

plan.question: Is it important to make the fix work on the client's specific version?

yes.question: Which version does the '{taskName}' is targeted for?
How much time does it take to test fix on version '{clientVersion}'?

plan.question: Arewe short with samples to test '{taskName}'? Should we collect or create more samples?

yes.question: How much time should it take to collect or create more samples?

bug.question: How much time should it take to reproduce the bug?

plan.question: How much time needed for writing UT's and E2E tests for '{taskName}'?
Can QA reproduce or test the bug? Make sure QA knows what to test
Is '{taskName}' may be shared with support or the team after work is done?

yes.question: How much time should it take to present '{taskName}'?

helper1: idNeeded, try share information prior to start writing code, in order to get feedback from experienced co-workers
helper2: Clean code but don't refactor. It may be difficult for your reviewer to observe your changes
helper3: Try writing your tests before writing your code
helper4: If you can implement it without the fear of bugs, try avoid dependencies so we won't be dependant on 3rd parties fixes
todo: show the user all the relevant parameters he wrote. For example: 'collect samples'
logTest: Test your logs, make sure everything is as expected
